DOC.brief_summary: In a clinical trial of 19 patients, 44 single-rooted teeth will be randomly assigned to one of four groups for: 1) no treatment, 2) manual root planing with curettes; 3) root planing with piezoelectric ultrasonic scraper [PU]; or 4) root planing with vertically oscillating ultrasonic device [VOU]. Post-treatment, the teeth will be extracted and their topography analyzed in 124 observations with white light confocal microscopy, measuring the roughness parameters Rp, Rv, Rt, Ra, Rq, Rku, and Rsk.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Root Planing on Surface Topography.
DOC.criteria: Patients undergoing programmed tooth extraction for chronic advanced periodontitis. Patients with no advanced periodontitis or patients that refused the treatment.
